-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Wednesday, February 22, 2006 10:03 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; jbrown@fladgate.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] XX Winter Olympic Games (ISP SMS 77)]

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.


-------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] XX Winter Olympic Games (ISP SMS 77)
Date:         Wed, 22 Feb 2006 15:01:31 -0000
From:         Jacqueline Brown <jbrown@fladgate.com>
To:         <abuse@theplanet.com>



Please see the attached letter.  In addition the text of the letter is set
out below.

Fladgate Fielder

<<isp_sms_.pdf>>

Dear Sirs

*Games of the XX Olympic Winter Games in 2006 in Turin, Italy - February 10
- 26, 2006*

We are instructed to write to you on behalf of the International Olympic
Committee* ("the IOC")* with respect to the Games of the XX Olympic Winter
Games in 2006 in Turin, Italy taking place between 10-26 February
2006* ("Torino 2006 Olympic Games")*

The IOC owns and/or controls all rights and data to the Games, including,
without limitation, all rights relating to their broadcasting, recording,
representation, reproduction and dissemination in any form and by any means
or mechanism whatsoever, together with the exclusive worldwide rights in the
Olympic marks, symbols, emblems and logos and, in conjunction with the
Organising Committee for the Olympic Games - Torino S.A. ("TOROC"), the
exclusive worldwide rights in the marks, symbols, emblems and logos of the
Torino 2006 Olympic Games* ("the Rights")*. The IOC has various exclusive
contractual arrangements in place with licensees around the world, including
in Spain and the United States of America relating to the exploitation of
the Rights.

We hereby give you notice that you are hosting a website:
___http://www.yourdailymedia.com/media/1139904717/Torino_2006_Winter_Olympic
s_Opening_

which:

      1.      Is or has been communicating/making available to the
      public by electronic transmission on the Internet, broadcasts,
      visual images (moving and otherwise) and/or sounds and/or other
      information forming part of a program or broadcast service in
      relation to which the IOC owns the exclusive worldwide television,
      radio and internet broadcast rights without licence or authority
      from the IOC, and

      2.      Is or has been displaying/using one or more of the Olympic
      marks, symbols, emblems and logos and the marks, symbols, emblems
      and logos of the Torino 2006 Olympic Games without licence or
      authority from the IOC and/or TOROC.

We ask you to cooperate in removing the site or blocking access to it
immediately and to confirm to us in writing that this step has been effected
within 24 hours.

In the meantime the IOC reserves all rights and remedies in relation to this
matter, including seeking injunctive relief, costs and damages, including
punitive damages, where appropriate.

Yours faithfully


Fladgate Fielder
